title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 25 April 2017 - XWiki
content:
<Aranjedeath> has quit  
08:56 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:14 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:27 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
09:49 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> has joined #xwiki  
09:49 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> Hello  
09:50 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> This morning I upgraded xwiki from 9.2 to 9.3. But now, I have this error :  
09:50 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5>  Migration of database [my\_wiki] has failed, it could not be safely used! Database is currentl y in version [90000] while the required version is [93000]  
09:50 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> anyone know why ?  
09:51 <Denis> you had an issue with the database migration to 9.3, and the why should appear somewhere before in the logs  
09:52 <Denis> the message you receive prevent access by XWiki 9.3 to a database that is currently not migrated to 9.3  
09:52 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> https://paste.ubuntu.com/24452883/  
09:53 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> logs when I restart xwiki : https://paste.ubuntu.com/24452883/  
09:54 <Denis> nothing in there, don't you have some message about database migration ?  
09:55 <Denis> can you also check that database migration is allowed in xwiki.cfg ?  
09:57 <faichelbaum> has quit  
10:00 <tmortagne> xwikiorg\_guest\_5: looks like you forgot to enable migration  
10:01 <tmortagne> see http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Upgrade#HUpgradingthestandarddistribution  
10:01 <tmortagne> (it's enabled by default but you probably disabled it to speedup startup)  
10:05 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> @tmortagne It's enabled  
10:07 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> other logs after restart : https://paste.ubuntu.com/24452929/  
10:08 <tmortagne> the log you pasted suggest there is an issue with your war, the missing class is supposed to be located in securityfilter-2.0.jar file  
10:08 <tmortagne> "No data migration to apply for wiki [xwiki] currently in version [93000]"  
10:08 <tmortagne> so the migration was executed it seems  
10:09 <tmortagne> ha no  
10:09 <tmortagne> the migration is executed but fails  
10:10 <tmortagne> the error suggest there is an issue in your xwiki.cfg file for the plugins property  
10:11 <tmortagne> seems like you have an empty entry in the list  
10:11 <tmortagne> which crash plugins loading (need to be bulletproofed)  
10:11 <tmortagne> probably a mistake when merging the xwiki.cfg file  
10:13 <tmortagne> search for property "xwiki.plugins" in xwiki.cfg file  
10:13 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> ok  
10:13 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:14 <tmortagne> it's supposed to look  like https://pastebin.ca/3802370  
10:14 <tmortagne> are you using the XWiki debian packages ?  
10:16 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> yes  
10:16 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> He look like that  
10:19 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> Yes, debian packages  
10:20 <tmortagne> so dpkg probably warned you about some conflict ?  
10:23 <tmortagne> anyway the issue you have seems to be around xwiki.plugins property so you should check it  
10:31 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> Thanks for your help  
10:32 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> I rollback to 9.2 and try again upgrade  
10:34 <tmortagne> xwikiorg\_guest\_5: I'm currently doing the same as you (9.2 -> 9.3 trough apt-get), I got a conflict and asked dpkg to do a 3 ways merge. Looks ok for xwiki.cfg but there is another issue, MySQL does not seems to like the new column we added...  
10:35 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: I'm ending up with "Failed updating schema while executing query [alter table activitystream\_events\_status add index FKBF7104E8CB8C5002 (ases\_eventid), add constraint FKBF7104E8CB8C5002 foreign key (ases\_eventid) references activitystream\_events (ase\_eventid)]"  
10:35 <tmortagne> ring a bell ?  
10:35 <tmortagne> reason given by MySQL is "Cannot add foreign key constraint"  
10:36 <tmortagne> no more details  
10:36 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> :(  
10:38 <tmortagne> xwikiorg\_guest\_5: you should probably stay on 9.2 for now  
10:44 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
10:45 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: added a bit more details to https://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-14225  
10:48 <gdelhumeau> Hi tmortagne  
10:48 <gdelhumeau> it does not ring a bell  
10:49 <gdelhumeau> hibernate is supposed to handle the foreign key and all details  
10:50 <tmortagne> looks like it does not handle it that well  
10:50 <gdelhumeau> so it comes from: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/56ba9a0dfbbafd9ea49558b238c515b622f31fca/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-activitystream/xwiki-platform-activitystream-api/src/main/resources/activitystream.hbm.xml#L69-L69  
10:50 <tmortagne> looks like it yes  
10:50 <gdelhumeau> damn  
10:51 <gdelhumeau> column="ases\_eventid"  
10:51 <gdelhumeau> but we have <column name="ase\_eventid" length="48" not-null="true" />  
10:51 <gdelhumeau> without the "s"  
10:51 <gdelhumeau> why I did not have any error ?  
10:51 <gdelhumeau> ah no  
10:52 <gdelhumeau> it's the name of the column I create  
10:53 <gdelhumeau> so yes, the column "ase\_eventid" exists in the table activitystream\_events  
10:57 <tmortagne> not really sure what does "Cannot resolve table name close to: (ase\_eventid)"exactly means  
10:57 <tmortagne> activitystream\_events definitely exist  
10:58 <tmortagne> it's a MySQL error so it's not expecting the hibernate table name  
10:58 <tmortagne> maybe it's expecting xwiki.activitystream\_events  
11:00 <tmortagne> maybe it's related to this version of MySQL  
11:00 <tmortagne> (5.7.17)  
11:04 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: could be https://bugs.mysql.com/bug.php?id=33027  
11:04 <tmortagne> i.e. the error message does not have anything to do with the root cause  
11:05 <tmortagne> trying the workaround they are talking about  
11:06 <tmortagne> no it's not that  
11:06 <tmortagne> the table is not partitionned  
11:06 <tmortagne> in any case what this issue indicate is that the error we got just means "there is something wrong with the refrenced table but no idea what"  
11:08 <faichelbaum> has joined #xwiki  
11:08 <tmortagne> found it  
11:08 <tmortagne> for some reason my table is MyISAM  
11:09 <tmortagne> lookin on another server  
11:09 <gdelhumeau> yes I was wondering if everything was innodb  
11:09 <tmortagne> the table was created by XWiki so there was a bug at some point and many people will probably have the error  
11:09 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:12 <gdelhumeau> bb in 30 minutes  
11:19 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: that was it  
11:19 <tmortagne> so now I end up with the nullpointer on getPlugins during the migration  
11:21 <tmortagne> I get this nullpointer only for subwikis  
11:23 <tmortagne> so in subwikis during the migrations the PluginManager stored in XWiki instance is null  
11:24 <tmortagne> and RecordableEventMigrator is calling AS plugin  
11:24 <tmortagne> closing XWIKI-14225 and creating a new issue  
11:28 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: https://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-14227  
11:29 <VincentMassol[m]> :(  
11:29 <VincentMassol[m]> I didn't completey realize we had a migration or I'd have tested it, there are almost always issues with migrations; they are very dangerous and needs to be tested a lot on several use cases and DBs  
11:31 <tmortagne> ok so from what I see when we are on main wiki we don't call the AS plugin si that's why it fail only on subwikis  
11:31 <tmortagne> vmassol1: you would probably have tested it only on main wiki which is also what gdelhumeau did I guess  
11:32 <tmortagne> s/si/so/  
11:33 <tmortagne> the worst is that we don't really need the plugin, we just call it to access a preference xwiki.cfg  
11:34 <tmortagne> vmassol1: I guess you can merge your  XWIKI-14217 on 9.3.x branch since we'll need a 9.3.1  
11:36 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: do you have time to look at it ?  
11:36 <tmortagne> updating the 9.3 release note  
11:39 <VincentMassol[m]> tmortagne: done for XWIKI-14217  
11:48 <pbondoerffer[m]> gdelhumeau: so i figured out what was wrong with it, apparently the code was checking if the elements were present in the page when adding the steps  
11:48 <pbondoerffer[m]> and on the edit page not all the elements of the steps were present and it caused some steps to be skipped over when creating the tour object  
11:49 <pbondoerffer[m]> the thing is, the code cant make those assumptions because if we have multipage it will not always be the case  
11:52 <gdelhumeau> back  
11:52 <evalica> has quit  
11:52 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: to summarize it's not possible to use plugins during a migration and your migrator use AS plugin when in subwikis  
11:53 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:55 <gdelhumeau> hmm  
11:55 <gdelhumeau> ah indeed  
11:55 <gdelhumeau> because of the configuration  
11:56 <tmortagne> ye  
11:56 <gdelhumeau> because the migrator itself does not use the plugin  
11:56 <tmortagne> yep  
11:56 <gdelhumeau> it's because of plugin.getActivityStreamPreference  
11:56 <tmortagne> no Preferences actually not xwiki.cfg  
11:56 <tmortagne> which is an issue since at that point you don't have access to wiki level Preferences  
11:56 <tmortagne> the database is not ready  
11:57 <tmortagne> I guess it was just optimization to avoid searching the database when not needed  
11:57 <tmortagne> so the fix is probably to do as if the store was always local  
11:59 <tmortagne> looks like I'm the next RM  
12:14 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: you're right  
12:15 <gdelhumeau> so shouldExecute() must return true always  
12:16 <tmortagne> i.e. remove shouldExecute  
12:16 <gdelhumeau> indeed :)  
12:17 <gdelhumeau> you want to me to do it?  
12:17 <tmortagne> sure  
12:17 <tmortagne> I prefer you take the responsability ;)  
12:17 <gdelhumeau> I see :)  
12:18 <gdelhumeau> well, at worse, it just find some empty tables  
12:18 <tmortagne> that's my understanding too  
12:18 <gdelhumeau> so I don't see any cause of error :/  
12:19 <gdelhumeau> so it's https://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-14225 ?  
12:19 <tmortagne> no  
12:20 <tmortagne> XWIKI-14227  
12:29 <pbondoerffer[m]> is there any way i can get the document action from javascript in xwiki?  
12:29 <VincentMassol[m]> pbondoerffer: don't know how to do it but it's in the page metadata probably  
12:29 <VincentMassol[m]> we surely have a js api for it though  
12:30 <pbondoerffer[m]> i looked in the docs but couldnt find it  
12:30 <VincentMassol[m]> for example I see in xwiki.jhs  
12:30 <VincentMassol[m]> for example I see in xwiki.jd  
12:30 <VincentMassol[m]> for example I see in xwiki.js  
12:30 <VincentMassol[m]> :)  
12:30 <VincentMassol[m]> XWiki.contextaction == "view"  
12:30 <VincentMassol[m]> in: if (XWiki.docsyntax != "xwiki/1.0" && XWiki.contextaction == "view" && XWiki.hasEdit && XWiki.widgets.ModalPopup) {  
12:30 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
12:30 <VincentMassol[m]> so seems that the XWiki js object has it  
12:31 <VincentMassol[m]> (lunch time, bbiab)  
13:06 <pbondoerffer[m]> mflorea gdelhumeau: the change introduced here https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/application-tour/commit/32b4ca207a37110c95f16eaa27256c757eda70a0 breaks multipages, because not all the elements of all steps will always be present in all the pages  
13:07 <pbondoerffer[m]> to fix this, id have to remove the if clause, but it would be a regression?  
13:10 <mflorea> I see. Now, there are two problems:  
13:10 <mflorea> (1) if you check the step presence before the tour starts then you don't support multipage tours  
13:10 <mflorea> (2) if you check the step presence when the user clicks Next, then you don't know how many steps there are in the tour (you can't show "Step 2 of 5" for instance)  
13:13 <mflorea> we can't have both. But we need to be aware that multipage tours have this downside: you can't know in advance how many steps will actually be present  
13:13 <pbondoerffer[m]> well the issue is that this if condition completely breaks a multipage tour because bootstrap tour expects all steps to always be there  
13:13 <pbondoerffer[m]> so the moment you remove one from the tour object, its lost and doesnt know what to do and just doesnt show anything  
13:14 <mflorea> now, this can happen on single page tours also, if you have dynamic steps. Imagine that some content is added on page when you click a button, without reloading the page. And you want to have a tour step for that content. Thus you can't check the step presence before the tour starts  
13:14 <pbondoerffer[m]> that too  
13:15 <mflorea> so I agree we need to \*move\* the if. We need to keep it thou, but in a different place. We need to keep it because an use case may be to show additional steps for a particular group of users (for admins for instance)  
13:16 <pbondoerffer[m]> what we could do is add dummy steps that dont have any actual contents. perhaps bootstrap tour will have its internal count?  
13:16 <mflorea> so the if should be done when you click Next. i.e. ideally, when the user clicks Next we need to find the next steps that is available, i.e. the next steps that has the target DOM element available  
13:17 <pbondoerffer[m]> oh alright, that makes more sense actually. i think its doable with the api too, because it has hooks for onNext  
13:17 <mflorea> s/next steps/next step  
13:17 <pbondoerffer[m]> okay i know what to do now  
13:17 <pbondoerffer[m]> thanks!  
13:17 <mflorea> yw  
13:18 <mflorea> with this we basically skip steps whose target DOM element is missing  
13:18 <mflorea> but the skip happens when the Next button is clicked  
13:37 <VincentMassol[m]> creating 8.4.6 versions in jira...  
13:38 <VincentMassol[m]> done

18:07 <gdelhumeau> don't take it bad  
18:07 <gdelhumeau> for the rest ping me tomorow

18:36 <VincentMassol[m]> guys any reason for the Help Center app to not be recommended?  
18:36 <VincentMassol[m]> I'm making it recommended  
18:38 <VincentMassol[m]> mflorea: I'm trying to install Help Center app 1.0 in a XWiki 9.3SNAP instance  
18:38 <VincentMassol[m]> I get a conflict in the DW on Help.WebHome which I find very strange  
18:39 <VincentMassol[m]> could it be that the Help.WebHome page is installed several times?  
18:39 <mflorea> yes, Help.WebHome is shared with xwiki-platform-help  
18:39 <mflorea> brb  
18:40 <VincentMassol[m]> ok so there's a problem to be reported since it should be a seamless install for users  
18:40 <VincentMassol[m]> shoudl I create a jira?  
18:42 <mflorea> sure  
18:43 <mflorea> if it's not already reported  
18:43 <VincentMassol[m]> k  
18:44 <mflorea> https://jira.xwiki.org/browse/HELPCENTER-3  
18:44 <mflorea> same, but for uninstall  
18:44 <VincentMassol[m]> should =i create another jira?  
18:45 <VincentMassol[m]> or is it the same fix?  
19:08 <Aranjedeath> has joined #xwiki

19:54 <VincentMassol[m]> ok will do thx
